review_title: Fine, but not the same as before
review_content: I like the color, but it is not the same as before. This one has more rose accents, while the older version was a bronzy mauve.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Wavy', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: LOVE this natural color. It’s the perfect blush that doesn’t look fake and too pink like so many blushes out there. It gives a really nice natural flush.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_title: Old Dallas was a great alternative for a bronzer
review_content:
This doesn’t show up and is not soft enough. When I first saw the old Dallas, I said this is unique and great of Benefit. I work with many Olive skintones and most bronzers can get muddy. Many also come from countries that don’t use bronzer, who knows how long heavy bronzers will trend, so I always used the old Dallas because it was a bronzer/blush and then used a little blush on the high points. It also had a little bit of a rosy tint that looked like a natural glow, unlike red tints or blushes. It was so genius.
…read more

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Normal', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I never really tried the original Dallas BUT about this one, didn’t show on my skin at all and it’s just a mini mini product.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Coarse', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: What is wrong with this company? Why “bring back” beloved products that aren’t the same products? Especially when the new products are inferior? This is not at all the “outdoorsy flush” that Dallas used to be. It’s a dull ordinary highlighter that’s too light to be even a bronzer. Like another reviewer said, name it “Fort Worth”...or Austin...or Nacogdoches...because it’s not Dallas!

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Normal', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I liked it, rosy bronze, pale so can build up to my preference. No concerns from me, nice smell.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Chemically Treated (Colored, Relaxed, or Permed)', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: This isn’t my Dallas... don’t call it Dallas
review_content: Not okay to just lighten this up. Want a lighter shade, make another blush. Call is Ft. Worth. I don’t care... Just give me back my old, darker Dallas. This new shade does NOTHING for me.

user_specs: ['Hair Condition Coarse', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: This a lovely light rosy matte bronzer. It basically has nothing to do with the original Dallas which was a reddish bronze that delivered a “sunburnt” effect. This is just a bronzer blush. No shimmer detected in mine but I do like the color. Very small size!
